prompt.p: A 24-year-old man presents to the Accident & Emergency Department after ingesting 50 tablets of 300 mg aspirin.
What is the initial disturbance of acid–base balance most likely to be?

modalFeedback.p: Option E is Correct. Respiratory alkalosis occurs early due to effects on the brainstem which cause hyperventilation.
Option A is Incorrect. Metabolic acidosis occurs later as the salicylic acid is metabolized. The initial disorder is respiratory alkalosis.
Option B is Incorrect. Metabolic alkalosis and respiratory acidosis do not occur.
Option C is Incorrect. Acid–base disorders are a major problem with aspirin overdose.
Option D is Incorrect. Metabolic alkalosis and respiratory acidosis do not occur.
